storyInfo: With both Victoria and Dublinn attempting to capture her, Reed doubts herself. Where can she go? Meanwhile, the Taran refugees in the woods who had almost escaped return to rescue her without hesitation.

attributes.content: I know what you're thinking, but none of your caterwauling will distract us.
attributes.name: Soldier on Guard

attributes.content: Really? Sounds to me like they're putting up a fight over their end. Sure you shouldn't give them a hand?
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Quiet.
attributes.name: Soldier on Guard

attributes.content: Hah. You've got some balls to be giving me lip, Viccy!
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Gugh—!
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Quiet, or I'll split your skull open.
attributes.name: Soldier on Guard

attributes.content: You—Victorians... what gives you the right?
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Don't oversell yourself, Taran. I've no prejudice or hate against your lot. At most, I think you're just sad.
attributes.name: Soldier on Guard

attributes.content: You're a political force to be used. A piece on the Dukes' board.
attributes.name: Soldier on Guard

attributes.content: We've been as friendly as we can be to you, since that's just common courtesy, but you should know a band of refugees dying here won't be any skin off our backs.
attributes.name: Soldier on Guard

attributes.content: ...Have we got orders?
attributes.name: Soldier on Guard

attributes.content: If they want backup, we'll do as the captain told us and deal with the ones here first.
attributes.name: Soldier on Guard

attributes.content: Target fleeing, inbound towards Team 1. Teams 1 and 2, continue the pursuit. All other units, retreat.
attributes.name: Special Forces Soldier

attributes.content: Give them the opportunity to regroup. We'll take them in all at once.
attributes.name: Special Forces Soldier

attributes.content: Reed, how'd you shake that investigator? Chenchen and I were just goin' to rescue you!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Hey, come on. Terra to Reed, let's go.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: There's fewer this way. Let's take this chance and break through!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Where are the others... Are they still by the forest?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I'd think so. We'll find a way out first, then we can save them!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: —Crossbowmen?
attributes.name: Ch

attributes.content: You thought you could waltz on out of here?
attributes.name: Special Forces Soldier

attributes.content: These crossbowmen didn't attack before.
attributes.name: Ch

attributes.content: Some of them are lying in ambush. There's no telling how many of them we're dealing with.
attributes.name: Ch

attributes.content: They must think really highly of us to greet us with so many elite troops.
attributes.name: Ch

attributes.content: Doesn't matter how many of them we're dealin' with. We've no choice but to fight past them one by one!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: No... wait, Bagpipe.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: We aren't the only ones they're targeting...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Ugh, you're right. They're reorganizing their forces.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: In which case... they're very quick at it. They must've planned this in advance. The opening they're giving us may well be intentional.
attributes.name: Ch

attributes.content: Would anyone more really come out to these barrens, though...?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Hostiles sighted!
attributes.name: Special Forces Soldier

attributes.content: Prepare grenades. Alert the decoy team.
attributes.name: Special Forces Soldier

attributes.content: The squadron emerges from the dark, like the ghosts that appeared on the County Hillock streets.
Bagpipe's grip tightens on her fortcracker.
...Dublinn.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: We've confirmed the enemy commander's identity. It's exactly who you said it would be.
attributes.name: Special Forces Soldier

attributes.content: The Redsteel Guard Captain... He came to rescue the Draco as a Dublinn member?
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Just as I thought.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: This might turn into an open confrontation between two dukes. The Iron Duke is seeking to turn County Trent into a battlefield. They won't act too rashly just yet.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Let's keep waiting for the most opportune moment.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Target sighted. Prioritize capturing her...
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: Ugh...!
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: Out of the way.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Your weapon... You're a Victorian soldier? She's got a Victorian soldier by her side?
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: Huh? Is that so strange? There's Victorian soldiers everywhere here.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Split the three of them apart! Don't waste time on anyone who isn't the target!
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: —We've secured the target! Team 3, evacuate with the target!
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: Target... You mean... Reed?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Urgh...!
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Long time no see, Loughshinny... Say, we're old friends, aren't we?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Don't be too nervous, now. And no getting worked up, either. Such a touching reunion—I can't imagine you'd approve of greeting your old friend with violence, hm?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: It really is such a shame. You know, you were always open to leave.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: In fact, the Leader's acquiesced to your little runaway act.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Are you... taking me back?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: But I can't go back. There'd be no place for me there anymore.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: No... there never was... any place for me.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: No, I understand. Not fond of your status as a shadow. Untrusting of the men recruited by your own lies.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: But where else could you go, if not Dublinn? Where would you make your home, as a Draco?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Loughshinny. Oh, poor Loughshinny... To tell the truth, I have some genuine sympathy for you.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: You see, you only ever spare a few more words for me when it comes to all that fictional poetry, all that made-up flowery language. It makes us feel like we really are old friends.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: If you had your own life to live, you'd be roaming the ancient moors like the bards do, or whiling the day away reading, cozied up in a nice little hut, making a living for yourself by writing copies... Wonderful, wonderful dreams, I can say that.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: So living aboard the ship must've been oh-so satisfying for you. Why didn't you keep laying low, I wonder?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: The Leader... knows, doesn't she?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: In County Hillock. So many innocent civilians, killed in the scheming and the plotting. She... She knew for the longest time, didn't she?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Well, you know her best. Why double-check with me?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: If they hadn't perished in the County Hillock melee, the Leader would've done it herself.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Truly, a series of shames. If 'The Elocutionist' and his merry men went about County Hillock following their orders instead of getting up to their little tricks, they could've lived out a few more days by the Leader's side.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: If Mandragora had done what she was told in Londinium and brought 'The Spy' back, she wouldn't have needed to die that horrible death down in the sewers.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: ...And if you'd just kept on staying in hiding out of fate's way, I wouldn't be so inclined to fetch you back for Dublinn, either.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: You should feel lucky, honestly, that I found you first. I'm sparing you the time you need.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: If it was 'The Brigadier' who came across you, he would have murdered you the moment you'd hesitated.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: No... They want me no more than a shadow. I won't live a life like that again...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Taking a spear to the ashes—has to be so much easier... than tearing clean through bodies of flesh and blood.
Hunf—! Alright, this'll keep you lot lyin' down!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Reed, how are you—
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: ...Don't look.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Every time she casts her Arts, Reed closes her eyes.
But not Bagpipe. Bagpipe sees a flame light atop the apex of her spear.
Right. Didn't she meet her in County Hillock? She was the Dublinn Caster stood under the statue in the square, staring coldly out at the burning streets, at the deaths of countless people.
She trusts Outcast, and Rhodes Island... and it makes her not want to believe her own impression, her sole single glance.
You're...
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Bagpipe, how is it going over there? Can you lure Dublinn's side and the Intelligence Service muscle together?
attributes.name: Ch
Bagpipe
attributes.content: Eh?

attributes.name: Bagpipe
attributes.content: Aye, I'm on it!
Och, you're not layin' hands on Reed! Out of the way!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: In the brief breath she catches between stance and attack, she reflexively looks behind herself again.
A mist sweeps across her view, crossing between her and Reed.
All units, use the fog as cover. Penetrate the battlefield.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Originium Arts! Stay alert! Gather up!
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier
Dublinn Soldier
attributes.content: Reconfirm your positions!

attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier
attributes.content: Ah! 'The Brigadier.' You're here... yes, you have command now...
attributes.joined: Eh?Aye, I'm on it!Reconfirm your positions! Ah! 'The Brigadier.' You're here... yes, you have command now...

attributes.content: She has to run. The fog is giving her a chance. She knows the strategy of turning a battle into an uncontrolled brawl well. All she has to do is take her spear up and spur on the flames.
But what comes after?
She is Dublinn's 'Leader.'
She stands for Dublinn's flames. She set light to the land in swaths. She took lives upon lives.
She made illusory promises, all in her own voice. She proclaimed, time and again, she would bring about a new age, one belonging to the Tarans.
Team 1, attack straightaway. Do not be concerned about hurting the target!
attributes.name: Special Forces Soldier

attributes.content: Dracos have excellent physical resilience! A few wounds won't kill her!
attributes.name: Special Forces Soldier

attributes.content: She is a Draco.

Her parents died on the snowiest of festival nights for this bloodline. She and her sister traveled to one city after another, living the childhoods that ambitious politicians who aimed to restore the monarchy had in mind for them.
She was born with her flames. Even now, her veins and organs can feel that scorching pain.
Where must she run to escape from that fate?
Once, she woke up on a sickbed aboard Rhodes Island. There, she laid on the bed and read. In the books were descriptions of Victoria's exquisite peace, of Tara's gentle, melodious madrigals.
But past her window, there outside, her injured allies would walk.
Even when she shuts her eyes, she can see the city in ruins. She was saved, but so many others died there.
Do it. Captain's given the order.
attributes.name: Soldier on Guard

attributes.content: Take care of them first, then we'll deal with Dublinn's lot.
attributes.name: Soldier on Guard

attributes.content: Don't worry, Taran. The blade works fast.
attributes.name: Soldier on Guard

attributes.content: Whoof... That was close...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Hah, Fionn! I knew it!
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: —Where'd you come from?
attributes.name: Soldier on Guard

attributes.content: Ugh...!
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: ...H-Help me! Help!
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Up! All of you who can stand, get up!
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: They haven't bound more than our hands! We've got the numbers! It's just three of them and one more who's hurt! We can take them!
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Right, right! Let's do it!
attributes.name: Excited Taran Refugee

attributes.content: We ran down that Viccy patrol in the village the other day! We can more than run this lot down!
attributes.name: Angry Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Hey, Fionn, how'd you slip free?
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: I... I was squatting over there to check on Reed. Nobody saw me, so I sneaked a rock and cut through the rope...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: ...*sigh*. Just thinking about it scares me. What if I'd been just that little bit late back?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Don't think about it, then. Unbind me, and we'll help the others. Hurry.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: I'll teach that stuck-up Viccy a lesson.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: We're sad? We're just being used? My arse.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: I just know there's nothing more real than the scars on my body, all the blood and tears I've shed.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: What gives you—any right in hell to take the piss out of us?!
attributes.name: Selmon
Soldier on Guard
attributes.content: Captain! There's an uproar with the hostages—

attributes.name: Soldier on Guard
attributes.content: Urgh—
attributes.joined: Captain! There's an uproar with the hostages—Urgh—

attributes.content: —Did I take him out? Sorry, I can't see very well.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Hah, pretty strong there, you are!
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Anyone else still tied up? I'll nab the Viccy's knife and cut you free.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Quick. He just sent word out.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Fergal, keep an ear out, see if there's any soldiers coming from that side. Fionn, get here and help up anyone who's hurt.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Move! Anyone who's got the legs, get going!
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: The refugee Tarans stumble frantically, running ever deeper into the woods.
They fled their homeland, those marshy soils, yet none are truly sure how fast they must run to leave the flames of war and death behind them.
If they can just escape this dark night, will that mean they can rebuild their homeland, free and peaceful?
Oi, Fionn, you know how to write. When we get out, write me a letter to send back home. Need to let them know I'm still alive.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Right, I hear you...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: I'll do you some elderflower liqueur, true to my word. Get me a good set of all the brewing stuff from the market.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Right. Noted, noted. Don't even need my account book.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: And then, all at once, they elect to stop in their tracks.
Someone lightly begins to whistle.
The Tarans have many things they cannot put into words. When they cannot find the words to express themselves, they simply sing.
They sing of glasses empty of alcohol, and loved ones who aren't there.
...Selmon.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: I know.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: I saw them fighting. Dublinn's in it, too. They're all looking to capture Reed.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Bagpipe and Ch'en are helping her, but it's just the three of them. Will they be fine?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: I can smell smoke. There must still be firewood burning that way, it's so thick.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: We might just be able to sneak ourselves inside, say, Selmon?
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Let's go. Grab the Viccies' sabers and stuff. See any weapons on the way? We take them.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.text: ...Where must we go to escape from the Tarans

attributes.content: We just took out those guards! Nothing to be afraid of!
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: We're not fighting a war. We don't need to do them all in. We just need to rescue Reed, and we're good!
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Moran, can you see? If the fire's not bright enough, take my hand and I'll guide you!
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: The smoke thickens. The waves of heat inch closer.
The woods are burning. Life is fading away.
Never has a soul called their names.
Never has a soul asked them their ideals, asked if the run they make is counter to the life they dream of living.
They bound ahead for the firelight, the one and only.
...'Reed.' Are they calling to me?
attributes.name: Reed
